Contributors Johannes Binotto is senior lecturer for literature, film and media studies at the University of Zurich and at the Lucerne School of Art and Design, as well as co-editor of the film magazine filmbulletin. His research focuses on the intersections between media theory, philosophy of technology and psychoanalysis. His latest publications include TAT/ORT
Perspektiven des Kinos auf den Raum

note: She is co-editing a special issue of Science as Culture on technosecurity (2018).
title: Kämpf is working on a dissertation on the history of pedophilia discourses. Her research focuses on feminist Science and Technology Studies and the history of sexuality

container-title: Reproduktionstechnologien in Literatur und Film (2011). Her co-edited books include Catastrophe and Catharsis: Perspectives on Disaster and Redemption in German Culture and Beyond (New York 2015
title: sciences, disability studies, postcolonial and animal studies. Her most recent book publications are Von und zu anderen Ufern. Ulrike Ottingers filmische Reiseerzählungen (2002) and “wie sonst das Zeugen Mode war”
